content.rendered:
Photo via Pexels

This Week in Genesis my thoughts are those affected by the attack in Nice, but I wrote 90% of this week’s edition yesterday (Thursday) so it seemed silly not to share it with you all still. And this week there’s:

  • New themes,
  • Rainmaker news,
  • A new podcast,
  • Plus the usual round-up of fantastic tutorials and showcase sites from the community.

As ever, I hope you find it useful and if I missed anything, free free to share it with me via the homepage.

Themes

First up, a new theme from StudioPress, the well put together Wellness Pro.

Announcing our new theme, Wellness Pro: A Holistic Solution for a Healthy Websitehttps://t.co/9zeEF33L6r #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/XCIDwqQWFN

— Lauren Mancke (@laurenmancke) July 6, 2016

Restored 316 has a new fashion focused theme out, entitled Dazzling.

Introducing Dazzling, our newest #genesiswp #wordpress theme! https://t.co/q73zg9wf3A pic.twitter.com/MJlDUT02e8

— Lauren Gaige (@restored316) July 14, 2016

And ZigZagPress are as prolific as ever with their 31st theme, Away.

Introducing our 31st #genesiswp child theme! https://t.co/uD07WK7db3

— zigzagpress.com (@zigzagpress) July 11, 2016

Showcase

Chilly Bin Design for historychannel.com.au

New on https://t.co/vUGfVnMBds, new Genesis showcase site from @chillybindesign https://t.co/U7cr3Vpavl pic.twitter.com/mYAoemG1n6

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) July 12, 2016

Ryan Townley with a new site (based on his Artisanal theme) for legacyballroomtustin.com

Just launched a new #genesiswp site: https://t.co/0Oq0w6EIZa. Customized version of Artisanal from @minimalgenesis pic.twitter.com/CqBzwZT3ue

— Ryan Townley (@ryantownley) July 11, 2016

Fran Eleazer for littlemountainreunion.info

Just finished a fun site for one of SC's oldest folk festivals. https://t.co/MoNsec6af6 #genesiswp #beaverbuilder #littlemountain

— Fran Eleazer (@FranEleazer) July 9, 2016

Cami MacNamara with a new site based on StudioPress’ Altitude Pro theme, maxinelennon.com

A new site by Webcami launched today using @studiopress Altitude Pro theme – https://t.co/EN58q1Dlt1 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/MqdUkuiIXp

— Cami MacNamara (@webcami) July 12, 2016

While one of my favourite Genesis designers, James Dalman ,relaunches his personal website, jamesdalman.com

Relaunched my personal website on #WordPress, #genesiswp, and @BeaverBuilder –> https://t.co/2GNakOMbXF pic.twitter.com/rF0tZ653oP

— jamesdalman (@jamesdalman) July 13, 2016

Justin McGuire for veap.org

Launching sites is one of the best ways to start a day! https://t.co/wnywhuseLD #GenesisWP #TeamVividImage pic.twitter.com/8lrFP1NmsM

— Justin McGuire (@jemcgui) July 14, 2016

Podcasts

Two of my favourite Genesis peeps, Jackie D’Elia and Tonya Mork chat on the first ever episode of rethink.fm

Did you catch Episode 0? @hellofromtonya is my guest and we're talking about rethinking the dashboard. https://t.co/mPi4FmZOGF #WordPress

— Jackie D'Elia (@jdelia) July 12, 2016

While over on OfficeHours.fm, the Genesis community’s own Carrie Dils chats with Chris Ducker on virtual teams, masterminds, and personal brands.

This week’s show comes early! Check out my interview with @chrisducker at https://t.co/dzE9PvQZch #officefm

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) July 13, 2016

Best of the rest

If you’ve been curious to try the Rainmaker Platform (based, of course, on Genesis) either for a client or your own site, you can now try for free for 14 days without a credit card*.

Try the Rainmaker Platform for Free — https://t.co/oH9gnHna24

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) July 11, 2016

Over at Know The Code, Tonya Mork has put out a serious amount of content recently, including:

  • Introduction to Modularity – Developer’s Genesis Starter Child Theme, and
  • The Loop Part 2 – Developer’s Guide to Customizing Genesis

Part 1: https://t.co/IvP9nEPa6Z
Part 2: https://t.co/FXbEgy5JKr

Let's master customizing #GenesisWP while we learn about programming.

— Tonya Mork (@hellofromTonya) July 10, 2016

Whew Part 1 for the #GenesisWP Developer's Child Theme is ready for you: 2+ hrs & 16 videos. https://t.co/kwYTwdMGG5 @KnowTheCodePro

— Tonya Mork (@hellofromTonya) July 14, 2016

Susan Ramsey’s been putting out some great content for Genesis beginners recently and her latest post will be useful to a lot of people too, troubleshooting tip for missing page content.

Troubleshooting tip for Missing Page Content: https://t.co/zHjLK5am5G #GenesisWP #Genesis4Beginners H/T @nickcernis pic.twitter.com/NtXhsNkqWK

— Susan Ramsey (@onehappystudio) July 9, 2016

While Calvin wants to know: Would you pay for a theme review / consultation service?

Would anyone pay for a theme review/consultation service? Do you already do that? #genesiswp

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) July 9, 2016

Anita has been busy with another new tutorial, adding a sales banner widget area to your WooCommerce shop using Genesis.

Add a Sales Banner Widget Area to Your WooCommerce Shop Using Genesis https://t.co/mZwoWSKpJg #genesiswp #ecommerce #bloggers #mompreneurs

— Anita C. (@TheCre8tiveDiva) July 12, 2016

Vishal Sharma shares some Actionable Tips To Optimize Your WordPress Site For Page Speed including some ideas for Genesis child themes.

Actionable Tips To Optimize Your WordPress Site For Page Speed

And finally, Sridhar’s been busier than ever with new tutorials on:

  • Adding a fixed shrinking header to Workstation Pro, Showcase Pro or Kickstart Pro
  • How to add a sticky message widget in Altitude Pro
  • How to add an additional parallax section in Parallax Pro
  • Adding a portfolio grid on Showcase Pro’s front page with title and excerpt on hover
  • Fixed utility bar and header in minimum pro and other customisations

Fixed Utility Bar and Header in Minimum Pro and other customizations:https://t.co/EJNgCzW5s3 pic.twitter.com/oBM4LKnSbN

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) July 14, 2016

That’s all from me this week, I’ll be back next Friday with more Genesis goodness for you all.

PS If you don’t already, I’d love it if you subscribe below and – if you’re already a subscriber – it is hugely appreciated. Thanks!

excerpt.rendered: Three new Genesis themes, a new podcast and Rainmaker news.
